document.text:
From: 
To:' 
Cc: 
Subject: RE: JE Release 
Date: Sun, 07 Jul 2019 20:14:26 -4)000 
Importance: Normal 
Attachments: 2019-07-04,_JE,_press_release,_draft.docx 
Do you have a more recent version than the attached (sent on Wednesday)? We were going to expand the FBI thank-you 
sentence to be the following: 
Mr. Berman praised the outstanding investigative work of the FBI, and thanked the New York City Police Department and 
Customs and Border Patrol for their assistance in the investigation. 
But defer to you if you have a different preference, and let me know whether you want me to incorporate or if you guys 
have the pen at this point. Thank you! 
From: 
Sent: Sunday, July 07, 2019 13:57 
To: 
Cc: 
Subject: Re: JE Release 
>*, 
Nypd is a task force partner on the fbi crimes against children squad, so we have the release set up as a co-announce with 
them, with a  slot for an quote, which we've asked for from dcpi. That being the case, we should acknowledge 
them with the same language we use for the fbi. 
Chief Public 
Information Officer 
U.S. Attorney's Office, 
SDNY 
(office) 
(cell) 
On Jul 7, 2019, at 12:37 PM,     wrote: 
I might put the thank you after the FBI but before he introduces our people in the remarks. Otherwise fine with me. 
MI, if you haven't already, we should loop in on the press conference issue. If NYPD plans to stand up I feel like 
he is going to want to know that and know who is going to be there. 
EFTA00026626

Sent from my iPhone 
On Jul 7, 2019, at 12:32 PM, wrote: 
just asked me if we should thank NYPD and CBP for their assistance, and I think why not, right? The more the 
merrier in terms of giving credit? He asked me to circulate a sentence for both of them, for adding to his remarks and 
the press release, but wanted to circulate here first and then I can send to the brass subject to this crew's input. 
Not that this is rocket science, but does this work, in the remarks after ". . . for their dedication and professionalism in 
seeing this investigation through.": 
I also want to thank the New York City Police Department and Customs and Border Patrol for their assistance in the 
investigation. 
And in the press release: "Mr. Berman praised the outstanding investigative work of the FBI, and thanked the New York 
City Police Department and Customs and Border Patrol for their assistance in the investigation." 
Thoughts? 
 Original Message 
From: 
Sent: Sunday, July 07, 2019 12:24 
To:
Cc: 
Subject: Re: JE Release 
Have we heard anything yet from nypd? 
Sent from my iPhone 
> On Jul 7, 2019, at 12:19 PM, 
> 
wrote: 
> Apologies if this has been asked/answered: do we need to thank the NYPD in the release and remarks? And did CBP 
play any role? Just wanted to make sure we're not forgetting anyone, thanks. 
> Sent from my iPhone 
EFTA00026627
